Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with a brick wall for a view”
Reviews.Author: fivestarsd
Reviews.Content: As others have reported this is a "boutique" hotel with small rooms. I don't mind that so much but the view out the window is of a block concrete wall about 10 feet away. Since few reviews mention it that means there are many rooms with a better view. Make sure you ask for a room that looks out onto more than concrete wall. The shower wand is just silly. It isn't the normal handheld shower nozzle that you can put in a holder and have it act like a hands free shower head. This is really a wand, a 10" long metal tube that sprays water in a line. It is impossible to affix it so that you can shower hands free. All that happens is that water sprays all over the small bathroom since there is no shower door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: JohnL63
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while attending a conference at the Convention Center. It was extremely convenient and the rate was very competitive as compared to some of the larger chains in the locality. The vibe is definitely towards the trendy and the boutique, but gladly it doesn't have the air of exclusivity that a lot of hotels in this category aspire towards. I found the staff very warm and welcoming. My room was spacious and comfortable. As with other reviewers, I would agree that there is a lack of natural light and my window looked out on buildings across a narrow alley. But I didn't come for the view. I didn't eat in the restaurant, which was always busy and buzzing, but breakfast was more than adequate. This is certainly a hotel to consider for short-term stays in the downtown area; for those who want to spend a longer period in LA, and to see more of the city, it is better to base oneself in the west, where most of the attractions are located.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my, O Hotel was FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineMS
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week staying at the O Hotel in Downtown LA. I had a fantastic holiday overall with my sister but must say that the O Hotel contributed massively to having such a great week. The hotel itself is a lovely boutique hotel with highlights including one of the most comfortable bed's I have ever slept in; access to Wifi; a hot, gorgeous shower and a lounge and bar area which were fab, but the staff - the staff went above and beyond. All of the staff were accommodating in particular Joel and Erin who not only provided standard maps, but tailor made suggestions of easiest routes of how to get about, places to see on arrival to some of our destinations along with print outs and other handy hints. The location was great for my sis and I who - shock horror- were in LA without a car and the staff made this otherwise frowned upon predicament easy as pie! If I could give 1/2 marks it would get 4.5 and if there was outside space (a roof garden or something it would get a 5).

Reviews.Title: “Close to action - the good and the bad!”
Reviews.Author: NWCN
Reviews.Content: As I have mentioned in the past, I am a frequent business and personal traveler, but have have remained grounded enough to avoid any wild "bias" swings. With that said, I will say the O Hotel was clean and conveniently located to the Staples Center and the Nokia Theater. The staff is somewhat attentive, but the place feels more like an Internet Cafe than a hotel. The room I had was small to average size, but the bath/shower area was extremely dysfunctional with a wand-like shower head and an open style shower that made it difficult to avoid spraying water all over the place. Although I write this laughing, it was really a pain in the $$$ having to ask for another floor mat and towels every time I showered. The free breakfast was more like bagels and apples, but don't expect plenty of them. If breakfast is your thing, you can try IHop across. If you okay with their breakfast. get there early or else eat what is left over. However, the biggest disappointment were the loud noises coming from outside throughout the day. Screaming and yelling from people either whacked out on drugs or drunk, wasn't something I expected at $215 per night. In addition, if you're not the type of person who can physically handle yourself, this may not be the place for you. Although no one tried anything on me, I was on edge there more than any of the times I have been in NY on business, and this is coming from a guy who has stayed at a Howard Johnsons in Jamaica, NY (near JFK) more than a few times. Overall, and it all fairness, it was not a bad place to stay, but the Luxe Hotel or JW Marriott might be a much better choice at similar prices. BTW - I love Virgin America Airlines!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, honest staff”
Reviews.Author: thequartz
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were efficient and polite. While checking out in a hurry, I left some personal items in the safe. Called the hotel and house keeping promptly recovered the items. I'm very impressed by the honesty and excellent service of the staff in this hotel.. Location of the hotel is excellent.. but parking is a problem. Guests have to pay $12 for overnight parking next to the hotel. Hope they can fix the bathroom sliding door too. The toilet always get flooded when I take a shower. Overall, I will give 4.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for my needs”
Reviews.Author: traveling_fiber_guy
Reviews.Content: This place in a great place to stay if you need to be close to the Staples Center. Pretty much everything that I needed was within walking distance, including a supermarket, a couple of drug stores, Macy, plenty of restaurants and bars, Kinkos... I would definitely stay here again if I was in the area. Decent room, comfortable bed, the lighting could be a bit lighter, and I have no idea of how the floor outside of the shower got wet all 4 mornings. There is a small workout room, but you also have free access to a gym. What I didn't care for was that there were so many street people in the area, and they would come into the hotel, only to be told by the front desk staff that they needed to leave. Also, when walking, day or night, you might have to step around them asleep on the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JeepForceOne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending 54th grammy awards, great location and close to every place i had to be. The rooms are clean and quiet, friendly desk staff. Great alternative to staying at the marriott for fifth of the typical room rate .

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here while attending the SAG awards. It was just what we needed. It was small and personal, the staff were knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. It was reasonably priced and continental breakfast was included. There is convenient (but not free) parking next door and the location was perfect. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Air Quality in the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the O because I was attending a conference at LA Live and didn't book the JW Marriott in time. I really had no trouble with the hotel or the staff. However, when I checked in to the room there was a really distinct and weird smell. A couple of other people at the conference mentioned the same issue. After a few days of sleeping in that room, I now have a weird chest cold that is reminiscent of when I stayed in a room with a mold problem in Mexico after the hurricane. The room is also incredibly dark (very poor lighting) and if you try to open the drapes, you'll see that you look out into basically an elevator shaft. They definitely have something going on with the air quality.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: dakotasgal
Reviews.Content: This is truly a boutique hotel. But yet, the room was quaint & small, The bed was comforable but you can hear the noise of the air condiditoners of the building next door, footsteps upstairs and next door especially at night! The worst thing was there was black mold on the rim of the shower floor. I had dinner at their restrauant downstairs. It was perfect. Food delicious. The music piped in was soooo loud, that I ate fast and went up to my room. You couldn't really enjoy the atmosphere. I would not recommend this hotel, too many others to choose from. No hotel parking, must pay parking garage next door $12.00 night. No validation either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuthSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to go to an event at Staples center, as it is a short walk. It was on the small side, but that's the way downtown hotels tend to be. Room was clean and modern, comfortable bed and small frig. The complimentary breakfast (bagels, pastries, coffee, tea, juice, fruit) wouldn't be enough for someone with a big appetite, but sufficient as a continental breakfast. The pastries were very good. We were worried that the room might be noisy since we faced the street side, but it wasn't. We parked in the parking garage right next door ($12).

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: ozyt
Reviews.Content: good hotel, located in downtown LA, it was very nice and clean. There is also parking located next door to the hotel which is always convenient

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: Len B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights after a trip to Mexico and to allow us to walk to the Bob Seger concert at Staples, super comfortable beds, modern decorating and a nice size refrigerator. Could not have been happier with the place, for the money you won't get a nicer hotel room in downtown LA. Parking garage right next door and lots of restaurants in walking distance..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover322
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because its only about three blocks away from the Staples Center, where we had concert tickets to see Katy Perry. We stayed one night, and the only complaint I have is the shower and bathroom. SInce this is a very modern designed hotel, our bathroom had a sliding "fog" glass door separating itself from the rest of the bedroom. It didn't feel as private as I would have liked. Also, the shower is small, without a door or curtain. If you tend to take long showers, beware of the excess water created on the ground, which will fall into the remainder of the bathroom floor. There's only a small step dividing the shower floor from the rest. I thought that was strange. Anyway, enough with the negatives. Aside from the bathroom, we enjoyed the bedroom very much. Its spacious enough for two people (King Size), with enough drawers and closet space for luggage. The bed is comfy and soft. We lucked out and had a nice window view of the city too. Score! There is a bar/restaurant downstairs, but we didn't have a chance to check it out. If we ever come to this LA area again, we'd most likely book this hotel again. ps...This hotel is also located a short driving distance from The Walt Disney Music Hall:)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not good”
Reviews.Author: LV_Kev009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted to be close to the Staple Center to go watch the Kings game,we booked 3 months in advance and when we got there they didn't have 1 of the two rooms we booked so we had to sit and wait until they got it all sorted out and then they still gave us a room that we didn't want we needed 2 Queens,they gave us 1 King,it was a complete joke at check in.The rooms were the size of a shoe box and beds were hard.The only thing good about this place is the bar.This Hotel is in the location with the seedy people just hanging out 2 doors down by the Subway Sandwich Shop.It is not a area you want to be out late in

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChimneyCrest0
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the O hotel, October 16-18th. Staff was helpful, rooms were clean, the bar was lively, and the internet was fast. A list of local restaurants with menus in the lobby would have been helpful, but we managed. i would recommend it for anyone looking to stay near the civic center in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the O.”
Reviews.Author: cdm79
Reviews.Content: Nice but small rooms, more European in style. The staff was extremely helpful. Their small restaurant was actually great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: justanameOregon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite lovely. Nice rooms and fantastic staff! For the price, you can't really beat it. However, a few warnings: 1) Don't waste your money on a CITY VIEW room. All you see is a building in front of you, not a city view. Plus it's really, really loud. 2) They have a hidden $12 service fee charge for things like "complimentary water." Usually, complimentary means free. So make sure and add $12 to whatever their rate is to not be surprised by how much you are actually paying. Their staff is some of the most competent and nice i have dealt with in a very long time and for a continuous traveler like me, this is a crucial part of a good stay. i would stay here again if i am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing was the BAR!”
Reviews.Author: Speedboattraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, but we were overcharged 2 times for the entire stay on our credit card and thank god we noticed and the amount was high enough to notice. I am wondering if they have done that before and gotten lucky nobody saw it. It wasn't a simple mistake since it happen 2 times so I am sure they knew it was done. When I called they said they were doing a credit, but then I waited a month and they never did it. I called again, spoke to the manager and then they argued with me about doing the credit. They then saw I was right, fixed it, but did not fully refund what was agreed before. Check your statements closely when staying at this hotel. The best part of this hotel is the BAR! This is by far the BEST BAR IN LA! The staff is friendly, caring, and the best anywhere. They helped me celebrate my dad's anniversary of his death with me and that was so special for me and they made it even more easier for me. I will always rememeber them for that. The stay would have been awesome if they just had not screwed up the credit card and the room was not the most comfortable either for a "king" room. GO for a drink but stay somewhere else to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good for the first time experience”
Reviews.Author: RestonMam
Reviews.Content: The rooms had a musty and moldy smell. The shower has no shower head and you have to take a shower using a small handheld shower head. The floor creaks and you can hear people walking on the upper floor. They put me in a room that was in the back of the hotel and I woke up at 5:00 am with the sound of garbage trucks which went on for one hour. After talking to the front desk, they informed me that they gave me one of the worst rooms and there were plenty of other choices when I arrived. One of the attendants told me that the room was not a good choice. He apologized, changed my room and asked me to talk to the manager. When I asked the manager, I was told that is not true and there is no such a thing and it is normal in LA to end up in a room that is backed up to an ally and you wake up to the noise of a garbage truck. There is a mandatory charge for getting two waters, use of Golds gym and internet which should be optional. Offering breakfast was nice and very convenient. The bar is nice and the bartender knows his drinks :) If the customer service was good, I would have given a better rating :(

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: sjack91
Reviews.Content: We are locals from L.A. and wanted an inexpensive but nice, clean hotel for a one night stay during the LA Food & Wine Festival Event. They offered a very competitive rate while other nearby hotels were extremly expensive for this particular weekend. They were very close proximity to LA Live/Nokia center where all the festivities were taking place. Yes the rooms are small but it didn't bother us at all (having traveled to NY and Paris) older establishments have smaller accommodations sometimes. Our room was clean, affordable and comfortable. You can also park next door for $11 a day in a covered parking lot which is what we opted to do. My advice - if you are staying more than 2 nights I would request a room facing the street for more of a view and better lighting. Our view was of another old building but that didn't bother us either for our 1x night stay. They now offer free gym services at Gold's Gym down the street which is nice. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: I stayed there awhile ago but still remember how clean and comfortable everything was. I did not get breakfast except my last day it was croissants, fruit and coffee, and the restaurant closed early so I didn't get to eat there. The desk people were nice, they allowed me to change and rebook because I caught a cold, and the lobby is cool/arty with rock star paintings and fireplace. Housekeeping put in fresh towels and made bed every day. Great value for LA, it is out of the way if you are going anywhere outside of downtown, but I would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel downtown, just ok”
Reviews.Author: starbabe2108
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at downtown LA, two streets away from the fashion district. There are some restaurants and a Ralf's supermarket around. The hotel looks from the webside better as in reality. The room's are ok, but small. The same with the bathroom, there is no shower curtain or something else, so the bathroom will be wet after shower. The hotel offer's a small breakfast means coffee, juice and croissants. There is no spa, but a small room for fitness. There is a parking garage next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Changing my last review from January from 4 to 2.5”
Reviews.Author: sylk1967
Reviews.Content: I gave high remarks back in January, but I'm changing my ratings based on reviews given in the past months. We had problems here with no hot running water, refrigerator being broken, and poor customer service (during reservations booking). Joe (front desk) provides excellent customer service, but with the Sales Manager leaving, it seems like this hotel has gone down. I will look elsewhere for my firm bookings as they weren't even apologetic for the lack of hot running water.

Reviews.Title: “O- NO!”
Reviews.Author: BRodBoston
Reviews.Content: I typically don't do boutique hotels, but this one had a 4star rating and was centrally located. So much went wrong: the site has the standard rate but explicitly states 10% off standard rate for 3nights or more. Well I had to practically fight for our 10% discount! They attempted to charge us a $250 surcharge for incidentals without informing us in advance. This is a matter of principle for me. When I asked for a total they handed ME the calculator! Also there's a small workout room with decent equipment, but they could not find the remote to the TV, and the AC never worked during our entire stay. They weren't even trying to find it or do anything about it. The one elevator didn't work for almost a day. The very worse part of the stay was the condescending attitude from the front desk. I can never understand how some in the service industry snub their noses at folks who keep them employed. It was really disgusting and unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. More than met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: hockshounds
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location as we were staying in central L.A for two nights. We came to L.A. by train, and we ended up getting in early(at 7:30 a.m.!) Took a cab from Union Station knowing that a room could not be ready. Joseph greeted us warmly upon arrival. checked our bags, gave us some suggestions on what to do until our room was ready. All through the visit, the staff was very helpful and professional making our stay very enjoyable! Their restaurant, bar and kitchen was very inovative, and we feasted on their small plate menu, and well made drinks our first night. Our room#302 was a Flower King. With a view of Flower St. Good room. Modern decor. It had everything we needed. Again, the staff made this stay. Thank you alessia,chris, christopher and joseph!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Wedding Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: UCLAdy04
Reviews.Content: I was a bridesmaid in my friend's wedding and she reserved a suite here for the night. We had a late check in that went very smoothly. The check in person was wonderful and offered us ice buckets and other amenities without us having to ask. He also brought up a rollaway bed very quickly to our room. The rooms are nice although not huge. The bathrooms are a little strange as the shower door doesn't enclose the entire shower so water can easily get everywhere. We had a great time before the night of the wedding and the suite area really came in handy for the day of the wedding. There is a nice continental breakfast in the morning though nothing fancy. A great feature is that there is a self-parking look next door which I believe was 12 bucks a day (no ins and outs). Anyone who has stayed downtown knows that hotel parking tends to run at 30-40 bucks a day!!!! So that really cut down on the cost. I would recommend this hotel if you need a suite downtown but not one that is too large.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about rooms with TV. Pick a room with street view, or else you'll be in a cave”
Reviews.Author: hsant
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Decent price, good location, clean, the guys in charge of the complimentary breakfast kept everything impeccable and were very serious about making a modest (but nice) breakfast, the best experience at this hotel. The Cons: Rooms are very dark, illumination is really (yes, REALLY) poor, that's why you're better off picking a room with a street view, that way you might leave the curtains open and have some more light during daytime, otherwise rooms face a wall or other building's windows, forcing to leave the curtains shut. At night, forget about reading or any other activity that requires some light. The shower is tiny. Everything in general is very small and narrow. But this is, in my opinion, the worst aspect. On a few reviews, before choosing this hotel, I found some people complaining because the rooms they got had no TV signal. My mistake not paying close attention to Tripadvisor reviews. I got one of those rooms. 10 minutes after arriving, the first night, I informed about it, and a guy came right away, just to tell me it would be fixed the next day, and that we would get a compensation discount. I stayed 5 or 6 nights, the problem was never fixed. I missed the NBA finals. When checking out, I reminded the person in charge about the problem and the promised discount, he said we would get a credit on our credit card. Never happened. What a nerve. Frankly, dishonest. According to the reviews, this problem has been around there for quite some time. It seems that this hotel just won't fix it, it just has some rooms with no TV, and they don't care. No matter what they say, no matter what they promise, be sure not to get one of those rooms. I wrote them later hoping for a positive response. No answer, nothing. All the public places have to face some problems, what makes the biggest difference is they way they handle them. I wonder if this is their attitude towards every single issue.

Reviews.Title: “They make froud to my credit card.”
Reviews.Author: Michellekrame
Reviews.Content: So disappointed about this hotel I didn’t even arrived to the O hotel when they make fraud to my credit card when I called to book a room, my credit card company told me about this I was in shocked and I tried to reach the manager but no answer, I sent emails and called but still no answered so I called to cancel obviously I wouldn't stay here because of that , Imagine what a scam. horrible.

Reviews.Title: “O How Awful”
Reviews.Author: johnwoodRTR
Reviews.Content: The room was like a prison cell. Tiny, hot, shower the size of a postage stamp. Window looked out on a brick wall. Bad lighting. Could not wait to get out of there the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hidden hotel!”
Reviews.Author: btripz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the first week in May 2011. It was our first time in LA. The hotel is nice inside an the front desk clerks were very helpful. The room was very small but it was comfortable. I wish my room had a microwave so we could have warmed up all the good leftovers we had :))

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Top Notch Food & Beverage Services”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingMan1969
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected surprise. I usually stay at the Bonaventure when I'm in LA on business but I had a limited budget during this trip. I got lucky here. The rooms are small (average small) but clean. However, with a bar like the one at the O, you don't stay in your room unless you are sleeping (or with a significant other). I'll get right to the point. The bartenders downstairs are the most talented I've come across. Their knowledge of vintage cocktails was very impressive. The span of obscurity should have been intimidating but your server was always there to guide you through; and with a heavenly smile (Elisa). I checked out today and I miss it there already. I'll never stay anywhere else when I visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - a couple of surprises”
Reviews.Author: moldey
Reviews.Content: My 20 something son and I stayed in the 0 Hotel for two nights recently as we were attending a couple of sporting events at Staples Centre. This hotel is in reasonably close proximity to the arena so is a good choice if you wish to walk and not drive. It's obvious the place has been remodelled and they have done a nice job. It's very chic inside but may seem a little quirky to a traditionalist. If you are driving you will be required to park in the adjacent parkade, which cost us around $11.00 per day. Considering this is downtown in a major city, it's very affordable. The hotel offers a continental breakfast which consists of small pastries, juice, tea, coffee, apples/oranges and bagels and toaster. On our second morning I arrived for breakfast one hour before it closed and they were out of bagels. I asked the attendent if there were more bagels and she said no and put the toaster away. Disappointing considering the hotel charges $12.00 extra per night for their "free" breakfast, "free" wireless, and a couple of other "free" things that they advertise. So, if you're on a budget and wish to stay at a clean hotel in downtown LA, then this is a good choice - just beware that it won't be as affordable as you may think after taxes and extra fees.

Reviews.Title: “Come here if you want to dance to the DJ... from the comfort of your room!”
Reviews.Author: timmne
Reviews.Content: This hotel, put simply, is more focussed on being profound and stylish than actually doing a good job. The rooms were cheap (although evidently for a reason - see later) and it was in a decent enough location. The hotel has a DJ in every night, in the bar area. He likes to play music that ensures anyone on the floor above gets to listen too - this goes on until 11 officially but it actually finished no earlier than 11:45 both nights we stayed there. I don't just mean a gentle hum through the floor; this was thudding, to the point that you could feel it. We were only in LA for three days and had loads to do - meaning staying up til almost midnight was not an option as we needed to be up early the next day. I complained the first night and the person on the front desk didn't really want to help. They did have other rooms but they'd be just as noisy apparently! The bed has sticky out bits which get your shins, the shower is like an irked snake and wants to jump off the wall to attack you, the water doesn't stay in the shower area and likes to wet everying on the floor (namely towels, with the lack of towel rails) and finally, there's hardly any space around the sink to put anything. The breakfast is back to the weird stylish-before-practicality thing; three choices of pastry and some orange juice. If you want an apple, there are loads. My wife is allergic to nuts so the one pastry she could have eaten, had been lobbed in with the nutty ones - meaning she was welcome to an apple if she wanted... We ate at ihop across the road which was terrible but at least filled us up! Good points - there's an inexpensive, secure car park right next door and the Staples centre is around the corner. The room was clean and the air con worked perfectly. I wouldn't stay here again and must must must learn that you get what you pay for, even if the hotel calls itself boutique - to avoid having to make a real effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: sylk1967
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute, clean & modern. This hotel was completely remodeled and is a great value as well as chic. The downstairs bar has appetizers fit for foodies and you feel like you're in a NY hotel (compact but very stylish). I would recommend booking online as the front desk tends to get extremely busy, but they're very good at calling you back promptly. If you need a corporate account, they will work with you and give you a great rate. Azzi (Head of Sales) is wonderful and awesome! She made special accomodations and worked hard to make us happy, and we are! Highly recommend staying here for fun or business. Few blocks away from LA Live, Ralphs (only supermarket this part of town), Macy's, and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bfernandes
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the O Hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The location is great. VERY safe and close to LA Live, Nokia and Staples center. Lots of parking around and even short term meter parking across the street.The lobby and restaurant is very chic and trendy. Great white rock fireplace with great couches and bar or food service. Cool music, great food and best martinis. The low lit room was also really cool except for the view. If a view of daylight is important, then pay the extra money upfront. We got the basic rate and when we opened the big beautifull curtain......we were shocked by a view of cinder block !!!!! The adjacent cinder block building is right up against the window. What a laugh we had !!!! It was fine as we were visiting USC and spent very little time in the room. A room with a view was only $20 more, but I did not realize no view meant a cinder block view. Great bed and room amenities. We took a red eye back to the east coast and they offered us a half day rate of $70, which was perfect before the late flight. If your into the big chains like Hilton, Ritz or Marriott's you will probably not like the O Hotel. It is an intimate boutique hotel very much like any Ian Schraeger or W Hotel; "Fetch" is the word!

Reviews.Title: “A sophisticate urban retreat in the heart of L.A.'s revitalized downtown”
Reviews.Author: napanapa_3
Reviews.Content: I was never a fan of staying at hotels in downtown Los Angeles until I discovered the O Hotel. An outstanding location provides easy access to L.A. Live, Staples Center, the Nokia Theater, the Convention Center and the Walt Disney Concert Hall. I love the feeling of being right in the center of L.A.'s energized and revitalized urban scene. The hotel's contemporary style is also elegant and sophisticated and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. I'd return in a hot second.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: OZinUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so we could go to the Basketball at the Staples Center. The location was good, a short walk to and from the Staples Centre. The rooms were clean and 2 rooms worked well for our family of 5 and well priced. The room had some city traffic noise in the morning but we expected this being downtown. Otherwise we found the hotel really quiet. The front desk staff were really helpful and friendl, in the afternoon, the evening and next morning. The helped us find a good restaraunt. The Continental breakfast was light but worked well for our family. Overall we all really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Beachkidboy
Reviews.Content: Was attending a concert at Staples Center and my go-to hotel had gone 'upscale' and to pricey for my needs of simply needing a 'bed to sleep in'. This was an old hotel which has been remodeled into a boutique hotel. Very small street-front, you would miss it if not looking for it. A small hotel with an adjacent independant parking structure ($11.00/day or $20.00/day for in and out priviledges). Very easy check-in and check-out. I had their cheapest room ($98 + change) which was smaller than my apartment, but all I needed to simply spend the night. Very comfortable bed, in-room mini-fridge (which I was told was being switched out so I brought a cooler anyways), coffee maker which I had to move to the floor to make the cord reach an outlet. Bizarre shower fixture which sprayed water into the bathroom since there is only a half-panel glass for the shower. The water sprayes into the toilet area which is only closed off by a semi-luminescent (?sp?) sliding door. Hardly any shelf space near the sink for personal items. No 'guide book' for hotel features, ammenities, restaurant/bar menu, etc... Clock radio had no directions as to how to set the correct time (it was incorrect and I had to call the front desk) or how to 'program' the AC/Heat unit. The hotel does have a bar and restaurant but they included none of this information in the room. They did advise me of the complimentary breakfast buffet which was nothing but juice, coffee, bagels, and dry pastry. I had to leave the lights on 24/7, even during the day as the 'window' was nothing but a 'trough' looking at the walls and air-conditioning pipes. I heard the people above me constantly, not partying or being wild, but just what appeared to be walking around, as well as people on either sides of the room. All in all, even though I was only there to rest before a concert at Staples, and get a nights sleep before driving home, it was an irritating time. I never used their bar/restaurant, there is a Subway, iHOP, and Ralph's just a block away. When I was told there may mot be a mini-fridge I brought my cooler, with ice, as there are no ice machines available.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FIND!!!”
Reviews.Author: BdrsMrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place to stay near the Staples Center and found the O Hotel. I was a bit leery as we knew nothing about it. I am SO GLAD we stayed!! Front desk personnel (both checking in and checking out) were not overly friendly but everyone else was very friendly. Our room was small but efficient and very clean! The bed was very comfortable :) We went down to the bar and CHARLIE was the best!!! A wonderful whiskey selection, and Charlie was well versed in many aspects of the bar. The food was to die for!!! We would totally go back and stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tek3339
Reviews.Content: I came here for business but was also looking for a little piece of the nightlife to be close to downtown. WELL WE GOT IT! The hotel also has a nice bar and restaurant downstairs but they BLAST techno music all night long. The hotel only has a few floors so there is no way of escaping the noise. I asked if I could be moved and they offered to move me on the same floor 2 doors down??? The hotel never followed up with me to see if everything was ok. THE ROOMS STINK. I could not believe how bad the room smelled...I was shocked. On the day of checkout we asked the person at the desk to call us a cab to take us to the airport. 20 minutes later we asked him how long it would be and he said he forgot to call. Keep in mind there was no one else checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingman1809
Reviews.Content: Arrived in LA with high expectations of this hotel from previous reviews. VERY disappointing! Room was small, dark and dingy, outlook was a breeze block wall 2 metres away, no restaurant, bar or room service on a Sunday, with minimal facilities in the vicinity and negligible help from hotel documentation or staff. Noisy air-conditioning, TV volume uncontrollable - oh, and watch out for the $12 per day "service" surcharge. When questioned about this, the receptionist said it was for the provision of room service, breakfast etc - but there was no service!! In a word, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Option at Downtown l.A”
Reviews.Author: sgavik
Reviews.Content: Location is great, heart of Downtown L.A opposite to Macy's Plaza and very near to entertainment hub of Staples Centre and L.A live. Rooms are nice, but think toilets are really small, food in the restaurent were really awesome, Business centre was a drag, we shouldn't call it a business centre, just had two desktop and few chairs, no printing or scanning option, no projecter, But staffs were friendly and offers a great competitive rate, have many eating options nearby, so overall for 2-3 days business stay or mid range traveller its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bring an eye mask”
Reviews.Author: jessbug58
Reviews.Content: Not a bad choice as far as downtown LA hotels go. Nicely designed lobby, restaurant and rooms - however there are some downfalls. I stayed on business working at the LACC in both May and June. The pluses: Close location to LACC, subway, and in one of the better sections of downtown LA. Easy to walk to LA Live, Staples Center, and the Nokia theater. If you have a night out and want to avoid driving home, not a bad stay for the price. The restaurant attached to the hotel is nice. However ordered room service one night and had my food delivered in to go containers. (??) The minuses: At night the O turns into a bit of a club. Make sure you room is on the 4th or 5th floor as to avoid noise from the lobby. I found the bed a bit hard and there is a light on the plasma that kept waking me up - bring an eye mask. Also they use a very modern shower head, actually a knock off of a modern shower head... great water pressure but it's a hand held, while there's a spot to hold the unit it doesn't quite work properly in static use. As a quick stay you won't be bothered but if you're in town for a week on business I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “gross room, misleading front desk”
Reviews.Author: dfwtravel
Reviews.Content: checked in, saw the room and immediately realized we had made a big mistake, room was extremely small, dirty, had stains of an unknown origin on the wall and also the chairs, told front desk we needed to move to a hotel with more room for 3 persons, were told "no problem, no charge, we understand" later got nailed on credit card with a cancellation fee. would never even consider of staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I was working late at the office and needed a place to stay so this review is only based on a 10 hour stay. I've had dinner at the hotel before and that was excellent. The service is also excellent. No complaints there whatsoever. The rooms however are not very big, very basic, and rather claustrophobic. Windows are small, open up to nothing, and the noise levels are pretty bad. I suppose this place will do in a pinch, but for about 100 bucks, what do you expect? If you need a place to stay downtown there are probably better options but if your budget is limited (don't forget $20+ per night parking EVERYWHERE in L.A.) and if you want a "boutique" feel rather than a big chain, give this place a chance. The exceptional service will more than make up for the average room.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh...its so so”
Reviews.Author: trick15
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are very deceptive! The rooms are smaller than they appear. There were iron burns in the carpet as it was worn. Open the window and you have a look into another hotel about 5 ft away. So suggest getting the Flower street side. The wireless didn't work on the 5th floor so was connected by a cable, though the lobby has wireless available. The restaurant and bar served great food and drinks...Room service was quick and was good as well. This is more of a place for a one night stop by but wouldn't recommend it for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tagny
Reviews.Content: The pros: One of the least expensive hotels I've ever stayed in in LA. The room and bed were comfortable and the staff was very, very nice. The cons: The staff had better be nice, considering all the problems we had with our brief stay. The bathroom door was broken and would not close. The remote control for the TV was broken and it took a full day to get it replaced. This was the single DARKEST hotel room I've ever stayed in in my life, and the bathroom, miserably, was the darkest part of all. Alas, the room was NOT dark enough to avoid seeing that there was actual graffiti painted on the wall of the room. How hard is it to paint over graffiti? Also annoying: I came home late and exhausted from my meeting to discover that, inexplicably, the keycard to my room had been disabled. It was just a matter of going downstairs to have it reactivated, but it was still very annoying. They also over-charged my card on the first night of my stay and took several days to adjust the charge. As others have noted, they advertise having FAR more TV channels than they actually have, and while there is a fitness room, the only treadmill was broken during our stay. The noise wasn't a problem and we stayed over weekend nights. All in all, I was bitterly disappointed to find out that I had friends who got a room at the Biltmore - right around the corner - for less than half the price of O Hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not As Expected”
Reviews.Author: lafamilleaventureuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential and it is nice, in a convenient location BUT......it is not as comfortable as one would hope for a boutique hotel. We found good rates on cheaptickets.com and booked through that. Upon 'check in' we were given a room that had windows with a view of the brick wall of the building next door. We called downstairs to ask for a change and were told that a room with a street view would be $20 more per night. That night, we were told a guitarist would be performing so we returned early from dinner. The set up was there but no musician so we thought he/she was on a break. We went up to our room and returned about a 1/2 hour later and still no one performing so I don't know what that was all about. Maybe the person didn't have an audience and ended up drinking at the bar? I recommend this hotel but with reservation. If you are looking for a convenient place to stay downtown- it's fine but skip it if you are planning a special weekend with a loved one. It's modern, small, has amenities but that's about it. Oh...and it costs $18 to park with the privilege of taking you car in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but subpar value and very average rooms”
Reviews.Author: PaulBz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for the Emmy Awards. Good spot right downtown. Great lobby - conteporary decor. nice staff. Rooms average with shotty workmanship. A boutique hotel so it was a gamble. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The W's Ugly Stepsister”
Reviews.Author: pharaohgirl
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience. We arrived at 10am and knew we couldn't check in until 3:00 so we checked our bags and toured L.A. We arrived back to the hotel at 4:15pm and were told "it will be 30 more minutes". While we waited in the over modern dusty, dirty, outdated lobby I noticed how filthy everything was and wondered what condition our room would be in. The first thing I noticed were dirty dishes that had been shoved into a cubby between our room and the room next to us along with some towels and garbage, inside the room the shower leaked, the beds were uncomfortable and it looked as if they were trying to be the Delano or the W but just couldn't pull it off with the black walls scratched and chipped and cheap furniture. The walls are incredibly thin and even on the 5th floor we heard the live music from the lobby all night long. The website makes this hotel look deceptively clean and polished and modern when really it looks like a tired nightclub from the 80's with a rather diffident staff and dim lighting. Save your money folks!

Reviews.Title: “This is my first and last stay”
Reviews.Author: 253Third
Reviews.Content: The first night the elevator began shaking so bad it has to be closed for 12+ hours so that it could be serviced. Fortunately for us we had taken our bags to the room before it began to shimmy and shake. Don't plan on watching much TV. They only have 4 channels, CBS, ABC and two unidentifiable channels. NBC was not available despite the fact that this was during the Olympics. Also don't plan on sleeping unless you get a room at the back of the hotel where the view out the window is a concrete wall. The lobby is taken over most nights by a very loud DJ. The bass beat reverberates through out the building. The noise near the elevator shaft is amazing. The bar guests havw something of an attitude and socialize in the stairwells up to the second floor. The furnishings are nice but minimal. There was only one chair; a desk chair in our room. The shower is like very small with a half glass wall and though I am a petite woman there was no way to shower with out spraying water all over the floor and sink area. The sink is very cool but there is almost no counter space and light is poor. The bed was very comfortable but there is a only one bedside table. The front desk staff is very friendly but either poorly informed or very good at playing dumb. When I called the first night to ask about the TV stations the desk person said there were at least 20 stations and that he would look into it. Two nights later the desk was surprised to hear there were only 4 stations. There are no ice or vending machines in this hotel. I so regret that I didn't heed the advice of the reviewer who complained about the TV stations and mediocre overall quality. I wrote the reviewer off as a crank- my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda cool, kinda funky, good deal for location to stay for the Nokia.”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Scott
Reviews.Content: Thanks to prior reviewers, when we booked our room we asked for a "quite" room. This means the top floor (they have 5). It WAS quiet. In the evening, as we walked to the elevator, we heard a the bass thump of a band that was playing in the foyer. There were lots of folks, but we did not hear it in our room. The room was nice, as you can see from pics, it is in modern decor which was cool and different. The bed was GREAT, flat screen TV worked nicely and we had a great stay. The front desk staff were very accomodating and friendly. We booked the room by calling DIRECTLY to the hotel rather than using an on-line booking site. This allowed me to ask about parking. It is right next door and costs $10 per night - $18 if you want unlimited in/out. While they do provide breakfast, we went down the street to a very cool vintage place called "the Pantry." Also, right across the street is an IHOP. We walked to the Nokia to see the Mark and Brian Christmas show and the walk was EASY and SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Was Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: monday161
Reviews.Content: I booked online so consequently got a "boutique" room. I was only there for a night but the room though small, was fine. It was very quiet (excellent), wifi was provided and easy to access free of charge and the shower was not some small poky affair. The breakfast hm, was complimentary so what can you expect I guess but not a lot of selection. Muffin, fruit and pastry. Staff was ever pleasant, however, one bad comment. The hotel was distinctly dark. Only word I can think off. Otherwise though, as a stopover hotel (without a family), I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Noise in bar intolerable”
Reviews.Author: suzla1234
Reviews.Content: The noise in the bar when they have a private party, especially with a DJ (which is often), is horrendously loud and the guests loitering out front are just as loud (and unbelievably tacky). Good luck sleeping here! I don't know how the guests sleep in the hotel next door either.

Reviews.Title: “Three uneasy questions *you* might want answers to before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: alteredego
Reviews.Content: Immediately after arrival: (1): "Where's my room?" The front desk clerk told me they were "sold out" until I presented a confirmation number. He left the front desk (to me) and searched upstairs for ten minutes until he found a room that was unoccupied, after which he gave me a key. (I'm not sure that there is a more invasive way of determining room inventory.) After opening the door of my room: (2) "What's that smell?" Previous reviewers have noted an odd odor in the rooms of this hotel. I couldn't decide if it was insecticide or a room deodorizer, but if I couldn't determine the difference, I'm not sure that it matters. (Maybe it was both.) The room itself actually had a sense of style and charm, but the stench of the surroundings overwhelmed the charisma. At 0530 the next morning: (3) "What's that noise?" A chorus of trash trucks emptying dumpster after dumpster greeted me on the arrival of what was otherwise a pleasant autumn day in LA. Although I appreciated the opportunity to welcome the sunrise, this cacophonous awakening wasn't at all what I had in mind. This hotel isn't a bargain at any price, in my opinion. Your mileage may vary, which is another way of saying that your experience might be less desirable than mine. I suggest you explore other accomodations. (I'm heading to the laundry now to get the weird smell out of my clothes.)

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Accommodations, Lackluster Service”
Reviews.Author: DLSalahi
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about my stay at the O Hotel in the beginning of Oct. 2009 was the construction noise starting between 5:15 - 5:30 every morning. Impossible to sleep once that got started. Other than that, the place was OK. The continental breakfast was a bit below par. Easy walk to L.A. Convention Center. Had trouble getting a light bulb replaced. Had to ask 3 times. The place seems to go for style over practicality. Example: open shower stall with faux stone was impossible to use without splashing water over the rest of the bathroom. First day I had a small flood before I got used to it. Similarly, atmospheric down lighting makes shaving one's upper lip (in the shadow of one's nose :) ) a bit of a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price, cool staff, very close to metro!”
Reviews.Author: chammaale
Reviews.Content: O Hotel is great. It's very welcoming. The room was great, the service was great. For some it might be too small, but I didn't need more for a 10-day business trip. The location is very close to the metro, a few restaurants and cafes nearby. Price is amazing compared to other hotels in the area. The only problem is that the sign and the number are not very visible so it's easy to miss it when you drive by. Breakfast is just muffins, fruit and coffee but you can find other places to eat nearby. Would definitely recommend it and stay there again. I didn't try the food but the bar and restaurant seemed quite popular and had live music some days.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: FunnyLaci
Reviews.Content: Merrill at the front desk was extremely friendly and went over the top to make our trip fabulous. The two guys that work at the front desk need to be fired or get laid and be happy. Bartender is SUPER. Food was kind of weird and not my taste. Rooms were small, but nice. No privacy at all in the bathroom (glass wall in shower), but if you're traveling alone or with your spouse, it's no biggie. None of the drivers in LA had ever heard of The O Hotel, so be sure and memorize the address. Hotel is in great location. Within walking distance of shopping, financial district, Nokia and Staples Center, and Metro. Will definitely consider staying here again when we visit LA again. Did I mention how helpful Merrill was?

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for convience to downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: bekrock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here so that we were walking distance to the Staples Center. We went to see game two of the NBA Finals. The hotel was very contemporary, but it wasn't an OMG! type of place. It was clean and the bed was soft. There is not much privacy between the bathroom and the bedroom due to the glass sliding door that separates the two. The room is super tiny and the view was of an ugly building next door. It cost us $18/day to park with in and out privileges. We did not eat at this hotel, but the staff insisted that the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: InternationalGal
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location, hip, comfortable hotel with attentive staff. Restaurant is great for meal or snack in fun setting. Rooms are efficient, a bit dark to operate safe which was in a dark corner of closet. Beds & bedding are luxurious. Business center is underserved with computers but efficient. For a business trip it provided everything that I needed including a good night sleep - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK..but expected more”
Reviews.Author: debntim1
Reviews.Content: from the discription, it was a " hip hotel'. the lobby and the front desk -bar area was that. the front desk and staff were more than helpful.. very freindly!.. but the rooms..had a slight odor-maybe cleaning chemicals or rug? well the tv only had about 8-10 channels, the room was a little small, and the bathroom doors where glass.. so little privacy. ..but they looked nice!. the bar was very cool.. no ice machine or soda machine. breakfest was muffins and fruit. the aircondition was very loud... but, it was close to the subway-which was fine. close to malss, and many restaurants. careful w parking . we parked the car right next door and the hotel stamps the ticket, cost-$10/day. we prob would try another hotel next time- we have stayed in better. no bang for the buck.. business trips-you'd be fine staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra28
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days in downtown LA from March.24 to 29 & stayed at the O Hotel on South Flower street. As a female solo traveller, I was a little apprehensive to stay in downtown LA but my fears were absolutely groundless. This hotel is on a quiet street with lots of places to eat all around like IHOP, Denny's, Coldstone Ice Cream, Ralph's Groceries, Subway, SanSushi and a little market that I went to a lot : Famimas. Lots of fresh fruit & sandwiches with a lot of other things you might need. This hotel is one block from the subway & you can ride all day for $5.00. The Staples Centre & LA Live are only 3 blocks away. There are lots of people wearing purple shirts riding bikes who will help with any questions & I found that most people were willing to help you with directions etc. The homeless people are not pushy or very visible where I went. There were a lot of security and police presence everywhere I went & I felt very safe even walking at night. I found my hotel room (Queen) to be very clean & charming with the bed being so comfortable I never had an ache or pain. The staff are great: so friendly & helpful but the best meal I had in LA was at the O Hotel restaurant. Everything was so delicious & well presented & my waitress was so friendly. She helped me plan my next day activities plus she recommended the meal that I ate. The continental breakfast was one of the better ones and kept me going till lunchtime. The Macy's Plaza shopping is small but there are a bunch of places for a quick meal. There is also a UPS store down the street. I really enjoyed my stay here because the staff are so great & the hotel is so quiet. I would really recommend this hotel for anyone but especially solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_Chuck
Reviews.Content: My fiance reserved the one and only suite for a romantic night. Sounds great, right? Well it should have been. We arrived at 3pm to check-in to our $400 room only to be told that they had given it to another customer. Did we want a regular room? No! What a bunch of bull. Would not recommend this overpriced, snobby hotel. Stay away.....far away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel for Downtown LA Event!”
Reviews.Author: Shinobi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the Giant Maximus NYE event in downtown L.A. As soon as we checked in the front desk staff impressed us. They helped me reprint our tickets on the hotel's printer and said yes to a 2:00 pm late check out the next day, no extra charge, no problem! The location is great for downtown events. The food in the hotel restaurant was pretty good. It was a tad expensive but that is expected in hotel restaurants. Bar had a hip atmosphere, house/downtempo dj. The staff there was very friendly as well. There is a huge Ralph' s Fresh Fare grocery and a Macy's within walking distance. It is perfect for stocking the empty fridge in the room. The rooms are small but very comfortable. Bed was comfy, too and the room was quiet (although we didn't get back there until around 4 am). Probably the only negative was the view of the ugly concrete building next door, but no big deal. Would definitely recommend for a nearby event and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Laker game”
Reviews.Author: kimokeo
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk to Staples Center. Our room looked out onto the wall of another building. Very small bathroom. The handheld shower was not practical. Park in the garage immediately next to the Hotel, as its only $10 per day. Rooms were very clean but spartan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, But Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: singsinthecar
Reviews.Content: I had to go to USC for business from Dec 1 - 5. To stick with the per diem for hotels, I chose to stay at The O Hotel. The lobby was trendy, and when my co-workers and I checked in around 11 pm, the doorman operated the red-lit elevator for us. I reserved a boutique room, which is the smallest room that you can stay in. Initially I was given a room on one end of the hallway. When I opened the door I was surprised at how small the room was. It seemed to be approximately 10' x 15', and I immediately saw the bed and almost walked into the mini fridge on the floor. The full-sized bed took up almost the entire room! The only positive things I can say about this particular room are that it was clean, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. The next evening I went to the front desk to ask if there were any other rooms available (of the same type) that were bigger. I knew that they existed because my co-worker was staying in a boutique room on the other end of the hallway, and it was a little bigger than mine. The woman at the desk gave me a key to the room directly above my coworker's. I was able to switch to it (at no additional charge since it was the same room type) and slept a lot better the rest of the week. I only have a few complaints about this room. There wasn't a lot of good lighting in the bedroom area, I could hear people throwing away garbage (like glass bottles) in the dumpsters in the alley below my room until 11 or 12 at night, and the closest stairwell to my room required me to go through a staff breakroom area when I reached the first floor. One of my co-workers complained about hearing garbage trucks at 4:30 in the morning, and another said that he could hear people "screaming" in the rooms on either side of his. I also had to get used to the hand-held shower and the open shower design to make sure that I didn't splash much water onto the bathroom floor. Overall, I would recommend The O Hotel if you weren't staying more than a couple of nights and don't mind noise. The people at the front desk were always very friendly and helpful (for example, there wasn't a remote in the fitness room, so the employee came in to turn the TV on for me). The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was free wired Internet. Because of the early mornings for work, there was still a lot of food available at their continental breakfast around 7 - 7:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Criminals”
Reviews.Author: toni1333
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small be ready to share a bed,there is no two beds rooms.You'll get a breakfast if you are lucky if you wake up early, in the first 15 minutes the brakfast is gone and thats all from the brakfast.the parking is so expencive. The most interesting is their way od staling money from international guests.We gave guarancy cash,and they gave us back when we left.After a week they took 250$ from our card with explanation that we made damage on the carpet.As a tourist we were in the room only for sleeping and it's absoluttely not true. so it's worst kind of criminal.When i contact them they said that they ll send us photos evidence and i steel didnt't get them. I ll send about this to all tourist sites.stay away.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place”
Reviews.Author: RobertSmithies
Reviews.Content: O Hotel is pretty small and pretty friendly for a downtown hotel. It's not perfect, but I'm still giving it five stars for the vibe. The staff was incredibly helpful in little details - like a late night martini when the bar was closing down, or printing out a boarding pass while we were out. The room was small but well decorated and very cool, and the euro bathroom (what else to call it) 'interesting'. Our room was on the street side of the building (four/floor - the rest of the rooms are apparently 'wall-side'). Issues: Could use more shelf space (e.g. in the bathroom!). The hotel is well located downtown, but the neighborhood can feel like walking a gauntlet at night. The Olevia flat panel TV - what a pain to configure it when we found it reporting 'no signal'. Otherwise, if you like this kind of place, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “O Hotel............just about bearable”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Hotel or now the O Hotel is a city centre hotel in the heart of LA. The best thing about this property is its location to the metro or macys! The property has been refurbed but is still lacking in many ways. The Rooms..............are small, odd lighting, dodgy tv, The Bathroom...........is their one????? The Stafff................untrained, dizzy, unhelpful and failed to even know basic knowledge about the metro service Downtown LA was also a dissapointment and one would be forgiven to think that only a couple of miles away Rodeo Drive and the faraway hills of Bel Air at Beverly Hills beckons!. I also felt unsafe in downtown LA which was surprising. Advantage of the O Hotel.............if on business in city centre,property is a great location

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly But Wouldn't Return”
Reviews.Author: JAM02
Reviews.Content: The "O" was clean and the beds were comfortable. When they quoted a rate of $162 we knew not to expect it to compare to the more upscale places charging $250 -$275. But still, I doubt we would stay there again. While the hotel only opened last year after they renovated an old building to make it "look trendy" the looks are superficial and looks alone can't make this place "trendy" for real. It's in a part of town that is in the process of being revitlaized, but that result seems far off and for now its in a rather isolated part of town with not much around it. The rooms are tiny and sparsely furnished. The furniture seems "cheap" although it photographs well. The bathrooms are just downright dumb and annoying (and tiny). The showers are dysfunctional and your bathroom privacy will be nonexistant if you're sharing your room. Your view is the alley window of the dumpy old residential hotel next door. Moreover, although the staff is friendly, it seems to be run by some fairly young folks who "aren't ready for prime time" and dont know much about how to run a hotel. For example, their concept of a concierge is whoever happens to be working at the front desk. She may tell you about her favorite place to go, but dont expect a wealth of information, a map, or even decent directions. They put a styrofoam coffee cup next to your coffee maker, but they dont understand the concept of leaving bathroom drining glasses in your room. We had to snag a cardboard coffeee cup in the lobby. They only give you a single bath towel and a washcloth but no face or hand towels. When we asked for extra towles, the manger handed us 3 bath mats. They say they serve a continental buffet breakfast in the lobby for $10, but when we you arrive you will see they have an extremely limited selection of food (you can pick the danish or muffin, thats it.)

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, No Frills stay”
Reviews.Author: liaNYC
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this hotel on Tuesday. Pluses- Location is EXCELLENT. Right across the street from an IHOP, Cold Stone, and Ralph's grocery. Not that I'm always in the mood for moderate style meals, but having these CONVENIENCES across the street was a big plus in my opinon. And I could walk to the Fashion Market Center (I was there for business) which, for a New Yorker, is another great feature. Hotel is NEW. And clean. Mod style decor. Boutique-hotel-feel makes for an intimate, easy place to stay. Minuses- It's not a LUXURY boutique hotel--which is fine, just know what you're getting. Restaurant was very mediocre. Even my glass of wine was just OK. Room was small, fine for 1 business travler, but if my boyfriend would have come we would have been tripping over each other. View was literally of a wall. About 14 inches away from my window. No "perks"... even the standard cups in my room were paper, not glass. Cable consisted of 12 channels. No bathtub. No room service. No wireless, but you can get an Ethernet cable from the front desk for free. Since location and ease of stay are my priorities I would give this hotel a 4. And the price was fair. Good to note--my room was pre-paid, but upon check-in they put a $100 per night hold on your credit card--without mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a scary downtown place”
Reviews.Author: martini98
Reviews.Content: I needed an overnight place to stay near Staple Center as I was going to a concert there. While it IS in walking distance, I wouldn't recommend it at night. As a single female I was very concerned about finding a hotel that I'd feel safe in. I felt VERY safe. The staff at the O was SO friendly. They all cheered, "Have fun at the concert" when I left. Since I just needed a place to sleep, as long as the rooms were clean, I was happy and they were. Clean, funky, and QUIET. I had a view of a wall, but who cares...I was there and then left. IHOP is right across the street and Subway is next door. There may not be any amenities but there is always something going on around the hotel. This is not a resort so don't stay if you're expecting more than a nice, safe, clean spot to rest your head and then go out and party somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, Ritzy, Chic, Happening, In, Divine”
Reviews.Author: thebopper
Reviews.Content: I found this Outstanding Hotel on the Expedia and to be honest was concerned with only 2 rewiews (one negative and one positive) but the reviews being a year apart i'm glad i stayed at this hotel. Rewiews are personal taste but if you're looking for accomodation that is well priced for Downtown LA this is ideal. I wanted something near both the Staples Centre and the Nokia Theatre, i couldn't have found any better as it is a short walk to both venues. The hotel is conveniently situated with transport (bus right out the door or train right up the street) There are great bars within walking distance but the bar only just opened in my stay will grow leaps and bounds.The bar staff are both friendly and informative professionally run by manager, Jana Although the restaurant wasn't open those who stayed were given a prelude to the sumptuous cuisine by one of LA's finest chef's, Corey. For the fitness minded, there's a more than adequate gym with a spa area (soon to be opened) The rooms are an ideal size with plasma tv, comfy bed and only criticism the shower area water goes everywhere. On your arrival you're greeted by extremely friendly staff who are superbly organised by manager Rebecca and her assistant manager, Arzi. This review is based on an extremely enjoyable stay at the LA's up and coming hotel you should take the opportunity to be apart of LA's finest.

Reviews.Title: “Getting There - will be good for solo travellers...”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchid Hotel in January 2008. Booked cheap via a web discount. Rooms are 'trendy' - but to me seemed a bit cell-like. Colours are all grey and white. A bit depressing really. And our window view - close up onto a wall - was not the best. The rooms are small and without a proper bathroom or bathroom door - just a sliding partition. You will get to know your friend very well if you are more than one in the room. On the plus side - flat screen plasma on the wall (no room for a conventional telly) and some trendy lighting and shower tiling made it a bit more homely. Also on the plus side - the hotel staff were great - and they are allowed to be real people rather than programmed robots. And as you'll see the lift is lit brothel red - so check the mirror in the room instead. 'Cheap' (for dowtown) parking right next door is safe and convenient. Prefer the Omni up the road.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: oxfordman
Reviews.Content: this is a true "little gem" of a hotel hidden in the ugliness of downtown LA...the area at night is a bit sketchy, but once in the hotel it was a steal for the price...have stayed in other "large" hotels in downtown that are twice as expensive and not nearly as nice...they have done a wonderful job making the rooms extremely stylish without losing their functionality...absolutely no complaints and would readily stay here again without hesitation truly a nice boutique hotel with friendly helpful staff...around the corner a block away is a 'roy's" that was very busy with great food

Reviews.Title: “small but fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Christine_U
Reviews.Content: I was totally charmed by this stylish hotel, and its young, friendly staff. It seemed like a great value for the price, to me. The Japanese-influenced decor is soothing yet fashionable, and the architects paid quite a lot of attention to detail. For example, the hollow in the shower for the fancy soaps and shampoo is exactly vertically centered among the rectangular tiles. (Tip: the bathroom does have a door--it's sliding glass, and not that easy to see at first!) I enjoyed the mood lighting (base of the bed lights up; elevator is red), though it might be difficult if you were trying to, say, work on your screenplay at night. The location is pleasant: a clean street on one of the better blocks of downtown, right near a new and fancy Ralphs supermarket. The lobby is glamourous--you could probably bring clients there, and make them feel impressed. A great place to be if you're planning to visit MOCA, the Disney Concert Hall, the Mark Taper Forum or Staples Center. I would definitely stay here again. the website is hard to find by Googling: it's [--]

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Zen chic”
Reviews.Author: TakeADeepBreath
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Orchid on business with a colleague. I was told the hotel just opened the week before (9/07) -- the fitness room was not ready yet, nor was the restaurant/ bar. The hotel definitely has style -- the elevator is lit in red, the beds glow from beneath, the wash basin is a stone bowl instead of sunken ceramic basin. I really enjoyed the decor. Even the stylish absence of a door on the shower amused me, although my colleague reported substantial water loss onto the bathroom floor. There were a few little irritations: my shower did not work at first (it was fixed that day); it took the hotel several hours to get my colleague an iron; the internet connection worked great, but it cost $5 to rent a cable, then another $5 when I left it at work and had to buy it; and my colleague's TV did not work at first. I assume these are mostly new-hotel kinks that will get worked out. The staff were friendly and helpful, and at $130+tax it was a fair bit cheaper than the Wilshire Grand nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value for location”
Reviews.Author: MA&DF
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried about our first trip to LA based on the hotel reivews I had read that were within our price range. However, the Orchid turned out to be great. Parking included and the location was very central. We walked alot, but taking the rental car out was also easy. The room was clean and basic. Something I really appreciated was that I forgot a personal item in the hotel and the mailed it to me at home in Canada - no additional charge. I would definetly stay there again and tell any friends I know that are headed to LA that this is a great choice.

HotelInfo.Name: O Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 819 S. Flower Street, Los Angeles, CA 90017 (Formerly Orchid Hotel)
